assigned_cwe_name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input
cwe_description: The product copies an input buffer to an output buffer without properly checking that the input buffer will not overflow the output buffer.
explanation: The code is vulnerable to buffer overflows in multiple switch cases. In the LY_TYPE_IDENT case, both sprintf and strcpy are used to copy user-controlled or derived string data into a fixed-size buffer (buf) without checking if the source string length exceeds the buffer's capacity. Similarly, in the LY_TYPE_DEC64, LY_TYPE_INT*, and LY_TYPE_UINT* cases, sprintf is used to format potentially large integer values into buf without any bounds checking, which can lead to an out-of-bounds write if the formatted string is longer than buf_len.
